Aphantasia uses strictly functional cookies for:
- Persistent login
- Persistent settings (such as graph size)

We use no third party cookies or services.

We store following data:
- Account data (registered users only)
	- Username
	- Password hash
	- Email (if provided)
	- User settings
	- Any created content 
- Technical logs related to hosting - notably:
	- IP address
	- Date and time of requests
	- Browser/client type

Account information is kept as long as the account exists.

Access **logs are stored for up to one month** since creation, after which they are discarded.

**Collected data is not** and will not be **sold to third parties** nor will it be used for tasks unrelated to development, maintenance or promotion of the website.

Note however, that any **content that you create is public** and therefore free for anyone to use as they see fit.

Aphantasia is a one-developer project that aims to create a self-hosted social space focused on humans and what they have to say.

If you want to hear me talk about it (and do a bunch of other graph-related stuff) **check out my youtube channel**:
https://www.youtube.com/@AphantasticChannel


**The code is open source** and can be found here:

Aphantasia: https://github.com/0rbit3r/aphantasia
	(front end and backend)

Grafika: https://github.com/0rbit3r/grafika
	(a javascript graph library powering Aphantasia)

[links_and_replies][Go back to "Links and Replies"]

There are three rules for creating links:

1) **Linked thoughts must exist** 
       (at least at the time of creation)
2) **Links can only ever point backwards in time**
      (how can you link to something that doesn't exist?)
3) **Every thought contains no more than 3 links**
      (because 2 is not enough and 4 is too many)

[join][Go back to "Join"]

**The building block of Aphantasia is a thought**.

A thought, just like a comment or a forum post, is just **some piece of text** written by some user.

This thought, for example, has a title **About Thoughts** and was written by user named **Green**.


Beyond that, thoughts also have a **date of creation**, **color**, **shape**, **size** and they are connected to one another by **links** which we will take a look next.
You are now ready to dive in.

[non-linearity][Go back to "Non-linearity"]

"""Here the user will be lead to create their own thought"""

[hello_explorer][TODO_DELETE]

**Welcome to Aphantasia!**

You are now on a path to create an account and join the hivemind.

Simply **click on the hollow circles to continue**.

[about_thoughts][Go back to "About Thoughts"]

Let's explore a few more ways to navigate around.

The **underlined text** 4 lines above **is** called **a link**.

**Links** reference the past and **can** be used to:
- **continue** a chain of thought (like I'm doing now)
- **mention** what you've talked about
- **respond** to what others have said
- **associate** multiple thoughts together


**Reply is the opposite end of link** and 

in practice it's a way to explore forwards in time. 

**This thought has two** replies:

(or more specifically, two **continuations**)

A consequence of the [3_axioms_of_links][3 axioms of links] and the key to mastering [reading_the_graph][Reading the graph] is __non linearity__.

Take a look at this thought in the graph view - since **it links two thoughts at once, it can be arrived to from two different directions**.

When you get to exploring Aphantasia, you will see this pattern everywhere - **thoughts reply, continue or expand** on other thoughts, **sometimes all at once**.

Thoughts that reply to more than one thought are called **associations**.

[links_and_replies][Go back to "Links and Replies"]

The colorful animation you hopefully see is called a **graph view**.

Now, notice that in the graph view the links are asymmetric - the replied thought is always at the wide base of a connection while **the linking thought gets the narrow end**.

In other words, if you imagine the link to be an **arrow**, it **will always point towards the future**.
